snippet: An official said the captain chose not to replace the rotted wood of the H.M.S. Bounty before departing because of the expense and time it would have taken.
abstract: Maine shipyard official says frame of replica of 18th-century sailing ship H M S Bounty that sank off North Carolina during Hurricane Sandy was rotted; federal safety panel is hearing testimony in Portsmouth, Va, about what led to sinking, in which one crew member died and captain was never found.
lead_paragraph: An official said the captain chose not to replace the rotted wood of the H.M.S. Bounty before departing because of the expense and time it would have taken.

headline.main: Virginia: Bounty Replica Showed Rot Before Sinking
headline.print_headline: Virginia: Bounty Replica Showed Rot Before Sinking
